channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pigeon carcass, 28th October
item.description:
Pigeon carcass attracting bugs and vermin in council-owned workshops. Located to the left by the staircase outside loos.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 41-48, Peacock Street, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Raised pavement, 28th October
item.description:
Last night tripped over raised this pavement which is a pound coin high !!!

item.title: Graffiti on the bus stop, 28th October
item.description:
On Montagu Road N9 opposite Montagu Road Recreation Ground there is offensive graffiti on the bus stop sign displaying the 192 bus timetable as you can see from the photo.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Montagu Road, London

item.category: Graffiti (Offensive or up to 2 meters off the ground)

item.title: Abandoned car not moved 1 year., 28th October
item.description:
This car has been here for 1 year and not moved. It is taking up valuable parking spaces for residents. It has damage to it which has been done since it has been left there and no one has attended it which is why I believe it to be abandoned.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Charminster Road, Chinbrook, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Bike, 28th October
item.description:
On lynmouth Road, opposite Quantock House, black bike tied up to a pole
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lynmouth Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continuous traffic blockage on Lynmouth Road, 28th October
item.description:
There is always traffic from both sides on Lynmouth Road. Cars on both sides honk and beep so that one side can reverse for them to go through. Our cars have gotten damaged and dented from road being to narrow and no space for 2 way traffic. Should be 1way
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Darenth Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Furniture, 28th October
item.description:
TV unit left on pavement

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Foulden Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken road surface, 28th October
item.description:
Road surface at junction of Sherwood Park Avenue & Harcourt Avenue broken and very deep. Riding cycle my wheels went down and very nearly got thrown in path of car. Is very dangerous for cyclists
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 240, Sherwood Park Avenue, Blendon, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A bag of rubbish dumped, 28th October
item.description:
The street has been finally cleaned after two months of no street cleaning and the cleaner left a bag of rubbish on the pavement a week ago. It still has not been collected and it is almost ripped. Please remove asap. Thank you!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Theydon Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Piss in plastic bags, 28th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lettsom Street, Camberwell, London

item.title: Brown window dumped opposite 7 The Avenue, Beckenham, 28th October
item.description:
A window with a brown frame has been dumped on the grass verge on the south side of the Avenue, opposite a block of flats 7 The Avenue on the north side. It has since been propped up against a nearby brick wall (see photo). It has been there for at least a week. Please can it be removed - thanks!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Avenue, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fridge has been dumped on the day the rest of the waste was collected, 28th October

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Church Road, Camberwell, London

item.title: Huge Amount of Fly-Tipped Rubbish, 28th October
item.description:
A huge amount of rubbish has been fly-tipped by the garages. Can the local team please clear it away soonest. This is the third time this has happened. The area needs CCTV coverage and signage. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Heavitree Close, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
